paper.abstract: Techniques are presented that allow A to convince B that she knows a solution to the Discrete Log Problem--i.e. that she knows an x such that ?x ? s (mod N) holds--without revealing anything about x to B. Protocols are given both for N prime and for N composite. We prove these protocols secure under a formal model which is of interest in its own right. We also show how A can convince B that two elements ? and s generate the same subgroup in ZN*, without revealing how to express either as a power of the other.
